intro: Gentiana flavidoflammea, commonly known as the yellow-flame gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, known for its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are characterized by their bright yellow-orange corolla with a distinctive red or orange throat. Gentiana flavidoflammea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
